title: Mourning the death of Charles Robinson, Sr., distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the  death  of Charles Robinson, Sr.,
distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Charles "Jerry" Jeryl Robinson, Sr., died on Sunday,  October
10, 2010, at the age of 67; and
  WHEREAS,  Jerry Robinson was born on May 19, 1943, in Penn Yan; he was
a 1961 graduate of Interlaken High School, and he was a veteran  of  the
United States Army serving from 1962 to 1965; and
  WHEREAS,  From  1968  to 1997, Jerry Robinson co-owned and co-operated
K-Mar Press, Inc. in Waterloo which he later sold to Seneca Falls Print-
ing, remaining with them as general manager  for  five  years;  he  also
co-owned  and  co-operated Tom and Jerry's Mini-mart, and he then worked
for Timber Harvester as a general manger for five  years  before  estab-
lishing Robinson Remodeling and Robinson Homes with his son, Chuck; and
  WHEREAS, Jerry Robinson also owned and operated Seneca Magnetic Signs;
he  served  as  Waterloo  Village Trustee for 10 years and five years as
deputy mayor; in addition, he served  for  years  as  Town  of  Waterloo
Assessor; and
  WHEREAS,  Jerry  Robinson  was  greatly  involved with Waterloo Little
League for 25 years, serving two terms as president;  he  also  refereed
football and basketball for 35 years from 1975 to 2010 and girls volley-
ball for 10 years; and
  WHEREAS,  A wonderful husband and loving father and grandfather, Jerry
Robinson distinguished himself in his  profession  and  by  his  sincere
dedication and substantial contribution to the welfare of his community;
and
  WHEREAS,  Jerry Robinson's commitment to excellence, and his spirit of
humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise, including charita-
ble and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, Jerry Robinson is survived by his wife, Deborah Ann, his son,
Charles, Jr., his four daughters, Denise, Nicole, Jennifer  and  Alyssa,
his  three  grandchildren,  Anthony,  Charles Julius, and Emily Kay, his
three sisters Carolyn, Kathy, and Sondra, along with many nieces,  neph-
ews, cousins, and friends; and
  WHEREAS,  Armed  with  a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with a sense of
compassion, and comforted by a  loving  family,  Jerry  Robinson  leaves
behind  a  legacy  which  will  long endure the passage of time and will
remain as a comforting memory to all  he  served  and  befriended;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
mourn the death of Charles  Robinson,  Sr.,  distinguished  citizen  and
devoted member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Charles Robinson, Sr.
